workflow.name: Automated CRM enrichment: Enrich HubSpot companies with CompanyEnrich
workflow.description:
This n8n template automatically enriches HubSpot company records using CompanyEnrich and keeps your CRM data up to date without manual work.

This workflow is ideal for RevOps, Sales Ops, and GTM teams who want cleaner CRM data for segmentation, scoring, and outbound workflows.

## Good to know
- Company enrichment is performed by domain, so a valid company domain is required.
- The workflow processes companies in batches to avoid rate limits.
- Enrichment is only applied when the API request is successful.

## How it works
1. A Schedule Trigger runs the workflow on a recurring basis (weekly by default).
2. The workflow fetches recently created or updated companies from HubSpot.
3. The company domain is safely extracted, even if stored in different fields.
4. Each domain is sent to the CompanyEnrich enrichment API.
5. The workflow checks whether the enrichment request was successful.
6. Enriched data is mapped into HubSpot-compatible fields.
7. The corresponding HubSpot company record is updated.
8. The workflow continues looping until all companies are processed.


## How to use
- Configure your HubSpot App Token with company read/write access.
- Add your CompanyEnrich API key as an HTTP credential.
- Adjust the schedule if you want the workflow to run daily or on-demand.
- Make sure your HubSpot companies have a domain set.
- Once active, the workflow will keep your company data enriched automatically.

## Requirements
- HubSpot account with App Token authentication
- CompanyEnrich account and API key
- n8n instance with HTTP and HubSpot nodes enabled

## Customising this workflow
- Change the schedule to run more frequently or trigger via webhook.
- Add filters to enrich only specific company segments or pipelines.
- Map additional enriched fields to custom HubSpot properties.

parameters.content:
## AI COMPANY ENRICHMENT FOR NEW OR UPDATED HUBSPOT COMMPANIES

### üìå How This Workflow Works?
1. **Schedule Trigger:** Finds the newly created or updated companies in a set time period.
2. **Extract Domain:** Extracts the domain seeds of the companies for CompanyEnrich enrichment API.
3. **Hubspot Update Company:** Updates the corresponding company with enriched data if enrichment success is false we log the error

### üõ†Ô∏è Before using
‚úî Create an Hubspot private app with company read and write scopes, add your app's credentials for both hubspot nodes.  
‚úî Ensure companies have a valid domain (required for enrichment)  
‚úî Create an Company Enrich account and enter your api key to HTTP Request node's header where it says `YOUR_API_KEY`.  
‚úî Map the enriched datas in Hubspot Company Update nodes.

### CUSTOMIZATION
1. **Filters:** Change the time period in schedule trigger and get recently updated companies nodes  
2. **Fields to Update:** Map the custom company properties in Update companies node


For more customization instructions, check the respective node‚Äôs sticky notes.

## Schedule Trigger & Extract Domain

Control how far back companies are enriched:

1. **Schedule Trigger:**  
   Set how often the workflow runs.

2. **HubSpot Get Companies node:**  
   Change the number in `7*24*60*60*1000`.  
   - `7` = last 7 days  
   -  Change this number to any value you want (e.g. `1` = last 1 day, `14` = last 14 days)

## Update Companies

Control which properties are sent to HubSpot by mapping them in the **HubSpot Update Company** node.

‚ö†Ô∏è Be careful to map **only one value per field** to avoid HubSpot API errors.

## Enrichment Loop

Enter your CompanyEnrich API key in the **HTTP Request** node where it says `YOUR_API_KEY`.

user.name: CompanyEnrich
user.bio: Acess exclusive company data of local and global businesses. Power your products, agentic workflows, and sales operations with fresh, instant company data APIs.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
